page.title: 11A Guide to Olveston
page.content: Olveston and Tockington are two small,quiet rural villages in the northwest of the county of Avon some two miles from the Severn Bridge.The surrounding areas are mainly a farming community but many of the residents of both villages commute into Bristol(8 miles)or further afield.Olveston has a church (St Mary's Church),a school,a village hall,a few village shops (a grocers ,post office ,newsagents ,butchers ,bakers and greengrocers) a garage, a pub and a quarry.Tockington is a smaller village with just a post office and a pub but does have a preparatory school that was once a manor house.
